sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference between (A x B) x {1} and A x (B x {1}), and show that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to the symmetric difference.
